author: Michael Larabel
description: Following the AMD ZenDNN 5.0 release from last year's EPYC Turin launch that brought big performance improvements for CPU-based inferencing with this open-source library compatible with Intel's oneDNN, today marks the availability of ZenDNN 5.1 as the next update...
title: AMD ZenDNN 5.1 Released For Enhancing AI Inference Performance On EPYC CPUs

author: Michael Larabel
description: Kdenlive 25.08 is out today as the newest feature release for this KDE/Qt-aligned open-source video editor. In addition to a number of new features, there are also many bug fixes including more than 15 crash fixes...
title: Kdenlive 25.08 Preps For Future Hardware Acceleration Features

author: Michael Larabel
description: Git 2.51 is out this Monday as the newest milestone for this widely-used, distributed version control system...
title: Git 2.51 Released With More Changes Preparing For Git 3.0

author: Michael Larabel
description: The Framework Desktop is a nifty and powerful mini PC powered by AMD Ryzen AI Max "Strix Halo". It's been a pleasure testing this small yet powerful Linux-friendly system that easily offers much better performance than the Intel Core Ultra 9 and superb energy efficiency. For complementing the data shared earlier this month in our Framework Desktop review, today's article is a deep dive into the power and thermals of the Framework Desktop in a few different configurations.
title: A Deep Dive Into The Power & Thermals For The Framework Desktop With AMD Ryzen AI Max

author: Michael Larabel
description: One of the areas worked on by AMD Linux engineers recently to better optimize the Linux kernel on AMD Ryzen platforms is for lowering the power consumption in S5 state due to some devices not being put into a low power state when the system is powered off.  Sent out today was the sixth iteration of these patches...
title: AMD Posts Latest Linux Patches For Improving S5 Power Consumption

author: Michael Larabel
description: The Firefox 142.0 release binaries are now available ahead of the official release announcement due out on Tuesday. Firefox 142 isn't bringing many notable changes but one is likely to cause some contention around Firefox Extensions...
title: Firefox 142 Now Available - Allows Browser Extensions/Add-Ons To Use AI LLMs

author: Michael Larabel
description: Merged today to Mutter ahead of next month's GNOME 49 release is an important improvement for those making use of Variable Rate Refresh (VRR)...
title: GNOME 49 Merges Late Mutter Change To Help Cursor Responsiveness With VRR

author: Michael Larabel
description: It's been 15 years already since the Illumos project was formed as based on the OpenSolaris codebase after Oracle's acquisition of Sun Microsystems and closing down OpenSolaris. Illumos Cafe is a new effort akin to BSD Cafe aiming to be a resource and helping to reinvigorate interest in Illumos-based platforms...
title: Illumos Cafe Hopes To Reinvigorate Interest In Illumos/OpenSolaris Derived Platforms

author: Michael Larabel
description: Ahead of the next Intel Compute Runtime oneAPI/OpenCL release, a new version of the Intel Graphics Compiler "IGC" has been released for Windows and Linux...
title: Intel Graphics Compiler 2.16 Fixes PyTorch For Battlemage GPUs, Adds BMG-G31 + WCL

author: Michael Larabel
description: The newest hardware offering announced by Raspberry Pi today is a 5-inch variant of the Raspberry Pi Touch Display 2...
title: Raspberry Pi Touch Display 2 5-Inch Released For $40
